description: A pregnant 16-year-old schoolgirl has died from a gunshot wound during a robbery in early Friday morning in Birmingham, Alabama.
title: Pregnant 16-year-old schoolgirl shot dead during a robbery in Alabama
title_page: Pregnant 16-year-old schoolgirl shot dead during a robbery in Alabama  | Daily Mail Online
text:
A pregnant 16-year-old schoolgirl has died from a gunshot wound during a robbery in early Friday morning in Birmingham, Alabama.
Raven White was eating a pizza in a car with her boyfriend when they were approached by a man who demanded money. The man shot Ms White and fled from the scene, leaving the 16-year-old girl and her unborn baby to die.
The suspect has been described as a black male, who was wearing a distinctive blue bandanna.
Raven White was eating a pizza in a car with her boyfriend when they were approached by a man who demanded money. The man shot Ms White and fled from the scene
Raven White was a 11th grade student at Clay-Chalkville High School and was described as a popular and outstanding student by her fellow pupils.
Birmingham police lieutenant Sean Edwards said the suspect was a 'cold blooded killer' and confirmed the suspect had fled the scene and driven off in a dark coloured car.
Raven's boyfriend tried to save her by driving to the St. Vincent’s East hospital but the 16-year-old and her baby could not be saved.
'Raven was the kind of kid that's the reason that I do what I do,' Clay-Chalkville principal Michael Lee said.
The 16-year-old schoolgirl died from a gunshot wound during a robbery in the early Friday morning in Birmingham, Alabama
Raven White was a 11th grade student at Clay-Chalkville High School and was described as a popular and outstanding student by her fellow pupils
'Just a sweet, kind, loving, young lady. She was such a good girl, the kind of kid every parent wants have,'
'She worked hard in the classroom. She never said anything bad about anyone,'
'She loved everybody and this is just a big loss. A loss we're going to feel for a long time,' Mr Lee told the Trussville Tribune.
